meanings.definition: To insert or fix firmly into something else
meanings.sent1: She carefully ingrafts the new plant into the soil.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon will ingraft the bone graft to aid in healing.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to ingraft a new ingredient into the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The idea seemed to ingraft itself into his mind, becoming a permanent fixture.
meanings.sent5: The key to success is to ingraft good habits into your daily routine.

meanings.definition: To establish or settle in a place, society, or organization
meanings.sent1: The new family hoped to ingraft themselves into the community quickly.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to ingraft new policies to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to ingraft itself into the dog's bed.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for music was ingrafted in her from a young age.
meanings.sent5: The artist's unique style ingrafted itself into the art world, leaving a lasting impression.
